abstract: Property developers in China are struggling to unload unsold units as potential buyers try to decide if prices will continue to fall.
snippet: Property developers in China are struggling to unload unsold units as potential buyers try to decide if prices will continue to fall.
lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — In Dongguan, a sprawling factory city, one real estate developer has cut prices by 15 percent, offered $1,600 worth of free appliances and even brought in a circus and a traveling zoo to move apartments.

headline.main: China’s Housing Resists Efforts to Spur Market
headline.print_headline: China’s Housing Resists Efforts to Spur Market
